page.title: 02Alfred's Tower
page.content: { {Alfred's Tower}at{Brewham}is just inside the county of Somerset on the Wiltshire and Dorset borders.This tower was built in{1772}_To the joy of {Parson Woodforde},who was able to see it erected through his spy_glass,and who tells us about it in his delightful diary.It is supposed to have been built on the direct line of march used by{King Alfred}when he passed from{Brixton Peverell}to{ {Eddington}in{879}. The base is made of green sandstone and the walls of red brick,and the upper portion of stone,thought to have been brought from the{Chilmark {quarries. }
